name: RideTo
slogan: We make it safer & easy for new motorcyclists to get on the road
description:
RideTo is making it safer and easier to experience the joy of riding a motorcycle. We’re the UK’s fastest
growing platform for new riders to find the best training, bikes and gear supported with expert advice.

Born out of personal experience and frustration, we're on a mission to disrupt an incumbent and lucrative market with awesome technology, brilliant design and a fantastic team. One product at a time...

Motorcycle training is just the beginning for us. Our vision is to end motorcycle confusion by building a community of informed and empowered customers who have access to independent and trusted information.

team.bioHtml: Founder of RideTo, Founder of Bright Bikes (Sold), New Entrepreneurs Foundation Fellow, Founders Of The Future Member

team.bioHtml: Entrepreneur that has built and grown Events, Web Design and Travel Brands with a foundation in sales & marketing. Currently Marketing Manager at RideTo

jobs.title: Customer Happiness Manager
jobs.description:
The Customer Happiness Manager is an integral part of the team, overseeing some of the most important processes in the interaction with rider customers and partner instructors. Candidates should be excellent at planning, resourcing, and managing any number of concurrent projects, with responsibility increasing rapidly as competency and knowledge of RideTo's services and systems develop.

** Please apply with a covering paragraph (150 words max) for why you want to join the RideTo team and what would make you a great team member


What we're looking for:
An organised approach with incredible eye for detail
An optimist with a warm, positive attitude who’s always willing to go the extra mile and put the customer first
A track record of delivering 5 star customer experiences
Hit agreed targets & objectives to ensure the business continues to grow and hits key milestones 
Represent the company values and culture and be an ambassador of RideTo and our mission
A strong interest in the motorcycle industry
Experience riding a motorcycle in the UK is a big plus


Responsibilities:
Customer relationship management and operations: Take a key role in running the day to day operations of the business, liaising with partner schools, customers and the team, continuing to improve and automise operational processes in the business and product.
Customer insight and analysis, constantly striving to tailor our product, brand and marketing to customer insights you develop.
Driving your own insight and knowledge into building a customer centric business 
Generally rolling up the sleeves and playing an integral part of a small but ambitious and hardworking team

Why it will be awesome:
You’ll be responsible for a huge part of the RideTo brand, marketing, voice and growth, you'll be the face of RideTo to our 1,000+ monthly customers
We’ll ensure you’re not only growing your operation and marketing skills but fully understand the mechanics of a fast growth startup, product and team
Your ideas and voice will always be heard, as part of a young and passionate founding team
We’re backed by some of the most successful entrepreneurs in the UK, growing 300% a year 
Friday beers, events, ride outs and other startup perks 

** Please apply with a covering paragraph (150 words max) for why you want to join the RideTo team and what would make you a great team member.

jobs.title: Regional Partner Manager - Freelance - Part Time
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a passionate, self-motivated individual to join our growing team. The position is a flexible, part time, commission based self-employed role. You’ll be out in the field as the face of RideTo within the motorcycle training industry, responsible for meeting, vetting and signing partnership agreements with new motorcycle training schools across the UK.

Areas of work will be agreed based on your own location and our expansion plans. This is a key role within the RideTo team, as you’ll be playing huge part in the nationwide expansion of the business and maintaining the high calibre of schools we allow on our platform. 

Responsibilities 
Researching and contacting potential partner schools in each new city 
Responding to and assessing partner school applications 
Site visits and assessments of potential new partners 
Communicating the value of RideTo’s services to new partners and signing commercial agreements
Represent and communicate the RideTo brand for making it safer and easier to get on two wheels 
Uncovering new market and business opportunities 
Relaying industry and market insights back to the business 
Playing a pivotal role in the rapid expansion of the industry's most exciting new brand 

Experience / Requirements 
Full, clean motorcycle licence for at least 3 years 
3 years or more experience in the motorcycle industry 
Advance motorcycle riding qualifications such as ROSPA, Bike Safe, ERS, IAM
Motorcycle instructor qualifications
Professional communicator, diligent and detail oriented 
Field based partnership/ business development experience a bonus 
Represent and champion the RideTo values: raise the bar, challenge everything, be infectious, deliver.

jobs.title: UK Brand Influencer - Part Time - A passion for motorcycles is a must!
jobs.description:
RideTo is on a mission to bring innovation to the motorcycle industry and get more people out of cars and experience the freedom of 2 wheels. We're passionate about making a difference and having a blast whilst doing it.

We’re currently looking for passionate, self motivated and outgoing individuals to join the RideTo brand influencer team. As a brand influencer, you will become the face of RideTo, out in the field (on your bike) spreading the word. It’s important to practice what you preach, so a love for motorcycles is a huge must!!! 

Our Company Values 

Raise the bar - Constantly look to improve what exists. We measure ourselves against our own high standards. 
Challenge Everything - Never accept the status quo. There’s always an alternative outcome to any result or existing environment. 
Be Infectious - Treat others so well, they have to tell someone else about RideTo and the fantastic team and service we offer. 
Deliver - When we say we’ll deliver, we always do. 


Responsibilities
Establishing new partnerships to increase customer acquisiton
Building industry partnerships to increase the coverage and product offering of RideTo 
Able to communicate the RideTo brand message clearly
Use word-of-mouth marketing techniques, like referring RideTo to friends
Provide feedback to the Marketing and Product departments regarding customers’ requests
Promotional activities in local areas with RideTo merchandise
Giving out promotional cards and stickers to delivery riders and potential new riders
Partner with local motorcycle shops and encourage them to refer new customers
Spread the word with local online communities and groups 
Thinking of creative ways to get the RideTo brand out there 

Requirements

Proven work experience as a Brand Ambassador, promoter or similar role
Strong social media presence 
Excellent communications skills
Professional attitude
An outgoing, friendly personality, and a desire to meet new people


Plus

Experience in retail sales
Currently studying BSc in Marketing or relevant degree
Photography experience 


Benefits 

Support and ongoing training : Whatever we can do to ensure you are a success in your role we’ll do.
Competitive hourly salary 
Unlimited bonus scheme - Every customer you bring in, you will be paid for!!

jobs.title: Brand Ambassador for Top100 Startup in London
jobs.description:
We are looking for a brand ambassador to come on board and join our great team (recently voted in the top 100 UK startups) and excel with us. The role involves an innovative, hard-working and outgoing individual to create new opportunities for the business. We offer great pay and commission alongside being flexible to how many hours you wish to put in per week. If Pay, reward, beer, merchandise and a future job sounds appealing, apply!!

———

As a RideTo Brand Ambassador you are the face of RideTo. You represent what partners think and learn about RideTo and how new riders discover us. Your main focus is to set up and manage industry partnerships that will ultimately, attract new riders to the platform. You will then be able to use these partnership to grow the RideTo community and increase our word of mouth referrals.


Responsibilities

Set up partnerships with local bike shops and food outlets to promote our rider training:

● Reach out to online partners to help give value to their audience

● Manage existing partnerships with delivery companies as well as winning new ones.

● Utilise your existing network to raise awareness of RideTo

● Distribute RideTo marketing material and events to activate the brand in your area and drive customers to the platform

● Be part of the RideTo team – online & offline – get stuck in!


What we look for in our ambassadors

Motorcycle shops

We partner with motorcycle shops to help their customers find local training, meaning they are able to sell more motorcycles. We offer the shops our promotional packs to give out to customers, however, this has to be closely managed to motivate our shop partners. For shops they have one place to send new riders, knowing the riders will get a great service.

Online Bike Shops

Very similar to the above!

When we partner with an online retailer the RideTo logo can be added to a partner’s website. This helps their users find the best training before they purchase a motorcycle. We can also create new rider content sections to further increase the value for their users.

Delivery companies

Many people who apply for delivery jobs do not have the necessary licence to to start work immediately. By partnering with delivery companies they can then refer these riders -we can then train them and get them on the road! A simple example would be Pizza Hut shops – they will have a list of new riders who need training as they hire them. We want to have that training contract with them. This is usually a per franchise basis meaning each store will have a local school they send riders to. Our value add is we have 20 vetted schools in London meaning we can train their riders faster and better. Normally with simple payment terms.


What we expect from you:

● Professional, diligent behaviour at all times

● Represent responsible motorcycling; correct equipment at all times on the bike you are working/representing the brand: Boots, jeans, gloves, helmet etc.

● Impeccable communication with all partners

● Keep us in the loop – with how you’re doing and how we can help

● Have fun, enjoy representing a breath of fresh air to the industry – be excited & ‘infectious’

● Represent our company values: Raise the bar, Challenge everything, Be infectious, Deliver.

● Deliver on agreed timelines & objectives


What you can expect from us:

● Support – Whatever we can do to ensure you are a success in your role we’ll do, helping to uncover new ways you can continue to work (and earn!) in a flexible way with RideTo

● Transparency – We’ll provide you with honest feedback and keep you in the loop with company plans and changes

● A growing, exciting brand and community – We’re just getting started on our mission to become the brand for new riders but already making an impact, we want all our team members to benefit from new opportunities that come as a result; new roles, responsibilities, markets and ways to get more people onto two wheels having fun.


Benefits

● Being part of an awesome team on a mission to make a difference in the motorcycle industry and having a blast whilst doing so

● Startup perks; regular socials, rides and free stash

● £8 per hour, up to (10 hrs max per week based on when you want to work + hitting targets)

● £5 commission for every booking through RideTo via your brand ambassador code
